𝗧𝗔𝗦𝗖𝗟𝗜 | Tracking tasks and records from the command line.  🔥 Super Hot!

⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬

𝗧𝗘𝗖𝗛 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗖𝗞: 🦀 Rust 
🎯 𝗨𝗦𝗘 𝗖𝗔𝗦𝗘: Tracking tasks and records from the command line.
📅 Created: Mar 2025 • Updated: Apr 2025

⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬

✨ 𝗞𝗘𝗬 𝗙𝗘𝗔𝗧𝗨𝗥𝗘𝗦 ✨

✅ Task creation with deadlines and categories
✅ Task listing with filtering and sorting options
✅ Task completion marking
✅ Record management (though not explicitly detailed in the provided README excerpt)
✅ Data storage in a local SQLite database


⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬

📊 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗧𝗦

⭐⭐ 20 𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗿𝘀
🍴 1 𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗸𝘀
🔍 1 𝗼𝗽𝗲𝗻 𝗶𝘀𝘀𝘂𝗲𝘀

⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬

📝 𝗔𝗕𝗢𝗨𝗧 𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧

Tascli is a command-line tool written in Rust for managing tasks and records. It allows users to create tasks with deadlines and categories, list tasks with filtering options, and mark tasks as complete. The data is stored locally in a SQLite database, providing a simple and efficient way to track personal or professional activities.

⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬

🔗 𝗟𝗜𝗡𝗞𝗦
• 𝗚𝗶𝘁𝗛𝘂𝗯: https://github.com/Aperocky/tascli

⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬⚬

𝗗𝗦𝗛𝗘𝗟𝗟 | Network forensic analysis  ✨ Notable!

◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇

𝗧𝗘𝗖𝗛 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗖𝗞: 🐍 Python 
🎯 𝗨𝗦𝗘 𝗖𝗔𝗦𝗘: Network forensic analysis
📅 Created: Dec 2014 • Updated: Apr 2025

◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇

✨ 𝗞𝗘𝗬 𝗙𝗘𝗔𝗧𝗨𝗥𝗘𝗦 ✨

✅ Deep packet analysis using specialized plugins
✅ Robust stream reassembly
✅ IPv4 and IPv6 support
✅ Multiple user-selectable output formats and the ability to create custom output handlers
✅ Chainable plugins
✅ Parallel processing option
✅ Enables development of external plugin packs


◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇

📊 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗧𝗦

⭐⭐⭐⭐ 5.5K 𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗿𝘀
🍴 1.1K 𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗸𝘀
🔍 2 𝗼𝗽𝗲𝗻 𝗶𝘀𝘀𝘂𝗲𝘀

◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇

📝 𝗔𝗕𝗢𝗨𝗧 𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧

Dshell is a network forensic analysis framework that enables rapid development of plugins for dissecting network packet captures. It supports deep packet analysis, stream reassembly, and multiple output formats. The framework also allows for plugin chaining and parallel processing, enhancing its versatility and performance.

◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇

🔗 𝗟𝗜𝗡𝗞𝗦
• 𝗚𝗶𝘁𝗛𝘂𝗯: https://github.com/USArmyResearchLab/Dshell

◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇

𝗣𝗜𝗫𝗜𝗘 | Kubernetes application observability  🔥 Super Hot!

✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱

𝗧𝗘𝗖𝗛 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗖𝗞: 🔨 C++ 
🎯 𝗨𝗦𝗘 𝗖𝗔𝗦𝗘: Kubernetes application observability
📅 Created: Feb 2020 • Updated: Apr 2025

✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱

✨ 𝗞𝗘𝗬 𝗙𝗘𝗔𝗧𝗨𝗥𝗘𝗦 ✨

✅ Auto-telemetry using eBPF
✅ In-Cluster Edge Compute for data processing
✅ Scriptability with PxL (Pythonic query language)
✅ Network Monitoring
✅ Infrastructure Health Monitoring
✅ Service Performance Monitoring


✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱

📊 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗧𝗦

⭐⭐⭐⭐ 6K 𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗿𝘀
🍴 463 𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗸𝘀
🔍 271 𝗼𝗽𝗲𝗻 𝗶𝘀𝘀𝘂𝗲𝘀

✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱

📝 𝗔𝗕𝗢𝗨𝗧 𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧

Pixie is an open-source observability tool for Kubernetes applications. It uses eBPF to automatically collect telemetry data, processes data locally within the cluster, and provides a Pythonic query language (PxL) for flexible data analysis. Pixie enables users to monitor network traffic, infrastructure health, and service performance within their Kubernetes clusters.

✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱

• 𝗚𝗶𝘁𝗛𝘂𝗯: https://github.com/pixie-io/pixie

𝗚𝗟𝗜𝗖𝗢𝗟 | Live coding performance, audio/music app development, and Rust audio library for various platforms.  🔥 Super Hot!

❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂

𝗧𝗘𝗖𝗛 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗖𝗞: 🦀 Rust 
🎯 𝗨𝗦𝗘 𝗖𝗔𝗦𝗘: Live coding performance, audio/music app development, and Rust audio library for various platforms.
📅 Created: Jul 2020 • Updated: Apr 2025

❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂

✨ 𝗞𝗘𝗬 𝗙𝗘𝗔𝗧𝗨𝗥𝗘𝗦 ✨

✅ Graph-oriented live coding language
✅ Audio DSP library written in Rust
✅ Runs on browsers, VST plugins, and Bela board
✅ Synth-like syntax for high-level control
✅ Sample-accurate audio synthesis in real-time
✅ Web app with near-native performance
✅ Decentralized collaboration using yjs


❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂

📊 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗧𝗦

⭐⭐⭐⭐ 2.6K 𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗿𝘀
🍴 84 𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗸𝘀
🔍 45 𝗼𝗽𝗲𝗻 𝗶𝘀𝘀𝘂𝗲𝘀

❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂

📝 𝗔𝗕𝗢𝗨𝗧 𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧

Glicol is a graph-oriented live coding language and audio DSP library written in Rust, designed for creating music and audio applications. It offers a synth-like syntax and real-time audio synthesis capabilities, and can be used for live coding, education, and audio app development on platforms like browsers, VST plugins, and Bela boards.

❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂

🔗 𝗟𝗜𝗡𝗞𝗦
• 𝗚𝗶𝘁𝗛𝘂𝗯: https://github.com/chaosprint/glicol

𝗧𝗘𝗡𝗩 | Managing multiple versions of OpenTofu, Terraform, Terragrunt, and Atmos.  🔥 Super Hot!

✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿

𝗧𝗘𝗖𝗛 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗖𝗞: 🐹 Go 
🎯 𝗨𝗦𝗘 𝗖𝗔𝗦𝗘: Managing multiple versions of OpenTofu, Terraform, Terragrunt, and Atmos.
📅 Created: Jan 2024 • Updated: Apr 2025

✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿

✨ 𝗞𝗘𝗬 𝗙𝗘𝗔𝗧𝗨𝗥𝗘𝗦 ✨

✅ Versatile version management for OpenTofu, Terraform, Terragrunt and Atmos
✅ Semver 2.0.0 Compatibility using go-version and HCL parser
✅ Signature verification with cosign and PGP (gopenpgp)
✅ Intuitive installation with Homebrew and manual options
✅ Callable as Go module with Semver compatibility promise on tenvlib


✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿

📊 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗧𝗦

⭐⭐⭐⭐ 1K 𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗿𝘀
🍴 43 𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗸𝘀
🔍 23 𝗼𝗽𝗲𝗻 𝗶𝘀𝘀𝘂𝗲𝘀

✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿

📝 𝗔𝗕𝗢𝗨𝗧 𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧

The `tenv` repository provides a version manager for OpenTofu, Terraform, Terragrunt, and Atmos, written in Go. It simplifies managing different versions of these tools, offering features like Semver compatibility, signature verification, and easy installation. It can also be used as a Go module.

✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿

𝗢𝗣𝗘𝗡𝗠𝗘𝗧𝗘𝗥 | Metering and billing for AI, API, and DevOps companies, enabling usage-based pricing and real-time insights.  🔥 Super Hot!

🎯 𝗨𝗦𝗘 𝗖𝗔𝗦𝗘: Metering and billing for AI, API, and DevOps companies, enabling usage-based pricing and real-time insights.

✅ Real-time usage event collection and aggregation
✅ Usage-based billing
✅ Real-time insights
✅ Usage limit enforcement
✅ REST API for integrations
✅ Client SDKs (JavaScript, Python, Go)


✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱✱

📝 𝗔𝗕𝗢𝗨𝗧 𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧

OpenMeter provides a flexible metering and billing solution for AI and DevTool companies. It collects and aggregates millions of usage events in real-time, enabling usage-based billing, real-time insights, and usage limit enforcement. The platform offers a REST API and client SDKs for easy integration.
